column4: anyone know where the config option is to see "shutdown" and "restart" in the "Quit..." section of the "System" menu?

i used to see them, but now I don't.  both suspend and hibernation don't work, and luckily i have shutdown mapped to my power button or i would be bringing up the console and typing sudo /sbin/shutdown or reboot
it's just when i hit System->Quit..., i don't see options for restart or shutdown.  i have log out, lock, suspend, hibernate, and one more i can't remember, but i can't see shutdown or restart
http://rapidshare.com/files/74380214/install_flash_player_9_linux.tar.gz.html
drop that in /var/cache and run "sudo aptitude reinstall flashplugin-nonfree"
!vncd
meh
!vnc4server
well, it's in the repository...  :(
*whiffs*
I'm at the static IP configure screen.  how do i know what to put in for IP, Mask & Gateway
you should have a network icon in the top right.  click that and manually configure.

you probably want some IP on your local network.  i.e. 192.168.0.x where the subnet mask is typically 255.255.255.0 for class C networks (i.e. 99% of home networks) and the gateway is your router's IP address (where the port is being forwarded from)
so my gateway would be the same address I go to to change my router settings?  192.168.0.1
yes
so my gateway would be the same address I go to to change my router settings?  192.168.0.1
yes

so i'm doing this for my wired connection.  whenever i change it to something other than "roaming mode" it doesn't even give me the option to connect to a wired network in my settings.  but i can still connect to my router wirelessly.
use "sudo ifconfig" on the command line to get the status for your network adapters
even if you don't see it in the network menu anymore, you should see it there
probably eth0, but could be other
